abstract.p: DoubleClick says its second-quarter loss narrowed to $3.8 million, compared with loss of $4.3 million a year earlier, despite advertisers' cutbacks; consolidated revenue rose 157 percent, to $128.1 million (S)

block.p: DoubleClick said yesterday that its second-quarter loss narrowed to $3.8 million, compared with a loss of $4.3 million a year earlier, despite advertisers' cutbacks. Consolidated revenue rose 157 percent to $128.1 million. DoubleClick said, however, that third-quarter sales were usually weak, adding in a conference call with analysts that the consensus sales forecast for the third quarter was ''very challenging.''
